item.title: Assumptions have an expiry date in software
item.description: Assumptions almost never hold The first customers in your SaaS product may be fine having a single e-mail linked to their account. But that doesn’t work for everyone. As your product gains adoption, more and more users ask to have a way to invite their colleagues to their account by e-mail. The assumption of “one e-mail address <> one account” is no longer good enough. The next step is to build a teams abstraction in your code, where one team consists of multiple users.
